Viking Ship At The Wharf Now

Climb aboard the world’s largest operating Viking ship, Draken Harald Hårfagre and discover your #VikingSpirit with inspiring ship tours, engaging crew demonstrations, and insta-worthy moments.

Wolfgang Puck's CUT Coming to Renovated Rosewood Hotel

Rosewood Washington, D.C., closing on October 17, 2018 for renovations, plans to reopen in Spring 2019.

'Nordic Impressions' at The Phillips Collection

Opening October 12, 2018 at The Phillips Collection is art from Åland, Denmark, the Faroe Islands, Finland, Greenland, Iceland, Norway, and Sweden, 1821–2018.

'The Comedy of Errors:' A Brilliant Night in the Theatre

One of Shakespeare’s earliest plays The Comedy of Errors is the story of two sets of twins, each with the same name—what could go wrong? Apparently everything that can.

New Film Festival Coming to Georgetown & Clarendon

Georgetown’s Halcyon and Arlington’s Clarendon Ballroom will be the venues for a new film festival – Flicks4Change -- that links the entertainment world with charitable activism.

French Embassy Classical Concert Oct. 12

The International Club of DC and the Russian Chamber Arts Society invites you to the Embassy of France for a delightful evening of classical music featuring the music of Alexander Zhurbin on Friday, October 12, 2018.

'Studio 54 Forever' at House of Sweden

House of Sweden has a new photo exhibition: Studio 54 Forever through December 16, 2018.

10 Habits To Help You Biohack Your Life

The secrets to optimizing your health and happiness are contained in your little daily habits. Biohacking is how you create the conditions of life, to “hack” your body’s biology and create the best version of you.

Wander Wisconsin Weekend

Georgetown’s independent businesses are the heart and soul of the neighborhood. Visit them Saturday, September 29 and Sunday, September 30, 2018 for special discounts and events along Wisconsin Avenue, including historic walking tours, live music, and additional activities.

Since 1933

International Couture Collection at French Embassy Sept. 23

Closing out DC Fashion Week is the 29th International Couture Collections Showcase on Sunday, September 23, 2018 at La Maison Francaise. This is one of the most unique fashion events in the tri-state area.

19th Annual Spirit of Georgetown Oct. 11

You are cordially invited to attend the 19th Annual Spirit of Georgetown on Thursday, October 11, 2018 from 6:30 - 8:30 pm.

This year’s event honors Rev. John Graham.

Brews, Booze & Bites at Tudor Place Sept. 22

Join Tudor Place for heritage food and drink, outdoor music and games, and ties to local history at Brews, Booze & Bites on Saturday, September 22, from 1:00 - 4:00 pm.

NEW DATE: Stroud Foundation’s 5th Annual 'Hoedown' in Georgetown Oct. 27

Brooke and Stephane Carnot will once again host a western themed “Hoedown” at their home in Georgetown on October 27, 2018 from 7:30 to 11:30 pm for dinner and danceing. This special event benefits the Stroud Foundation, named for Mrs.

Georgetown Village to Host Presentation on Climate Change Sept. 26

Climate and climate change are hot topics of conversation, especially when temperatures soar and weather extremes occur with ever increasing frequency.

Hervé Maury and His Beasts Now at Ligne Roset

"The animals that are here always look at us and are very surprised," says Hervé Maury with a twinkle in his eye. Endowing animal characters with complexity and humor, he celebrates all manner of bestiary, including insects, giraffes, koi fish, and mice.

Monaco This Year; Mars By 2030

Monaco or Mars: Either way, fasten your seatbelts.

Shop Georgetown Twilight Sept. 13

Play and slay in DC’s style district for an evening of shopping deals, sips and bites at 65+ stores and restaurants as DC transitions into the fall fashion season and everyone’s back from summer vacation.

Georgetown Pop-Ups Now

Been shopping in Georgetown lately? International brands and local entrepreneurs test market with innovative and unique concepts in Georgetown retail spaces.

'For Whom the Bell Tolls'

In memory of Senator John McCain.

John McCain: A Republican, A Hero, An Enigma

John McCain is many things. He is a Republican, a hero and an enigma. I respect and honor his service to the nation during war and peace but was not sorry he lost especially in the general election when the person he lost to was Barack Obama.

Join Morgan Care Pharmacy's Barry Deutschman's Retirement Reception Aug. 30

Barry Deutschman, a Georgetown fixture, a favorite neighborhood pharmacist and owner of Morgan Care Pharmacy (30th & P Streets, NW) for 25 years, is retiring. A reception in honor of Barry will be held Thursday, August 30, 2018. Drinks and light fare will be provided.

'Dawoud Bey: The Birmingham Project' at NGA

Starting September 12, 2018, on view at the National Gallery of Art is the recent acquisition of four large-scale photographs and one video from Dawoud Bey's most important series,

LOC 2018 National Book Festival Sept. 1

A diverse lineup of authors – including 40 who write for children and teens – as well as readings, trivia, costumed characters and interactive exhibits will provide a wide variety of family-friendly activities at the 2018 Library of Cong

5K Race to Beat Cancer Sept. 15

The Four Seasons Hotel Washington, DC is proud to host the 2018 Four Seasons Hotel Washington, DC Race to Beat Cancer 5K on Saturday, September 15, 2018.

Guapo's Open in Georgetown

You know Guapo's from Tenleytown, where owner Hector Rincón opened the original Tex Mex eatery 27 years ago.

Good Riddance to 'Silent Sam,' UNC’s Toppled Civil War Statue. Don't Bring Him Back.

Stone statues honoring the dead helped draw me to the University of North Carolina.

'Locked Up Abroad'

In memory of Senator John McCain. First published April 16, 2013

KC Presents 'Music and the Mind' Sept. 7

Music has been fundamental to every human civilization. Why do we have music—and what makes it so powerful? What does current research tell us about the role that music can play in human development and learning?

'Pas de Deux' at Susan Calloway Fine Arts Gallery

Pas de Deux will be Judith Vivell and Jim Perry's first joint exhibition at Susan Calloway Fine Arts. Perry's sweeping geometric forms echo Judith's broad brush strokes and the arcs and curves of her compositions.

Drink the District at The French Embassy Sept. 7 & 8

Wine and summertime rhyme, and that's no coincidence! Raise your glass to summer and enjoy unlimited samples of more than 50+ wines at La Maison Francaise at The French Embassy September 7 & 8.

Could the Sweetest Watermelon at Wednesday's Rose Park Farmers' Market be Yellow?

"The sweetest watermelon at the moment is yellow." That was Katherine Tallmadge's conclusion after tasting every darn watermelon at the Dupont Circle Fresh Farm Market on Sunday.

Rodney Crowell Live at The Hamilton Aug. 25

Enjoy a one-evening-only performance by Rodney Crowell at The Hamilton on August 25, 2018.

Pre-Diabetes: Reversible If You Do Something NOW

Many clients come to me feeling frightened about being diagnosed with "pre-diabetes," or "borderline diabetes." Don't get me wrong, it is a scary diagnosis, as it's a precurser to full-blown diabetes, which could happen any time.

'Young Sophie Bell' at House of Sweden Aug. 26

Last in the Swedish summer film series, Young Sophie Bell (Unga Sopie Bell) will be shown on August 26th from 3:00 to 5:00 pm at House of Sweden, 2900 K Street in Georgetown.
Two Talented Artists at Gallery 50 Rehoboth Beach

Martha Jackson Jarvis at Dumbarton Oaks

Extended until September 2, 2018, Dumbarton Oaks's installation of mixed media sculpture and works on paper, all inspired by natural forms and materials, by noted Washington artist Martha Jackson Jarvis.

A Great Deal on Peaches, Peaches and More Peaches at Rose Park Wednesday!

Fill a big bag of peaches for only $30 from Quaker Valley at the Rose Park Farmers Market for the next several Wednesdays. "We have too many peaches!" they told me at Sunday's Market.
